curam.util.persistence

Class ConcreteDAOImpl<I,E extends Entity<I>,S extends DeepCloneable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.persistence.DAOImpl<I,E,S>
      • curam.util.persistence.ConcreteDAOImpl<I,E,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the identifier type used by both:
    • the logical entity; and
    • the row used to "seed" the entity
    E - the type of entity instances which are created by this class.
    S - the database row from which entity instances are created.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReaderDAO<I,E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StandardDAOImpl

    @Implementable
public abstract class ConcreteDAOImpl<I,E extends Entity<I>,S extends DeepCloneable>
extends DAOImpl<I,E,S>
    Base class for DAO implementations. Creates entity instances by:
    • getting a row from the database, and creating new in-memory entity representation of that row; or
    • creating a new entity suitable for later insertion onto the db.
    The ID of the entity must also be the ID of the row used to "seed" the entity.

    • Method Detail

      • getEntity

        protected E getEntity(S row)
        Gets the instance of the entity seeded from the row supplied. If an entity instance seeded on the row has already been created, it will be returned from the entity cache; otherwise a new entity instance will be created in memory and added to the cache. If the row of data is different from that cached, an exception is thrown, since business decisions may have been based on out-of-date data - this can occur if another transaction updates and commits the row during the scope of this transaction.
        Overrides:
        getEntity in class DAOImpl<I,E extends Entity<I>,S extends DeepCloneable>
        Parameters:
        row - The row of data read from the database, used to seed the entity instance.
        Returns:
        The entity instance seeded from the database row supplied.

      • newInstance

        public E newInstance()
        Creates a new instance of the entity, suitable for later insertion onto the database. If the entity instance implements Validator, then this method calls Validator.setNewInstanceDefaults() to allow the entity to set any default values for new instances.
        Returns:
        TODO: JavaDoc.

      • newInstance

        public E newInstance(EntityInfo<I,E,S> entityInfo)
        Creates an in-memory instance of the logical entity based on the entity information supplied.
        Parameters:
        entityInfo - The information about the instance to create.
        Returns:
        An in-memory instance of the logical entity.
